column5: Hey guys.. i have an old hummingbird LCR400ID portable. it was my dads, he got it for Christmas one year in the early 90's. it was barely used, but it works great. runs on 2x 6V lantern batteries or it has a 12v lighter plug as well. it has a 16 degree transducer. does anyone know if there is an easy way to rig it up for ice fishing? it has a suction cup type mount for moving from boat to boat ect. or does hummingbird have a replacement ducer for the ice? i will get a few pics of it up in a few hours. thanks in advance, Chris F.
No ice ducer available. Use the old hockey stick rig. Remove the suction cup and use a screw through the hole to attachit to the stick.

Lots of guys have rigged their regular transducers to use on the ice.    The other end (not sure why I didn't take a photo of it???) has a simple hinge attached to another piece of wood. Most "newer" hummingbirds do have the same transducer attachment but I don't know about an older model.

I used mine for year on the ice ...and it worked like a charm.  I actually screwed the transducer (where is screws onto the suction cup onto an old hockey stick shaft and made a little T at the top with a single screw so I cold fold/turn it flat in the Trunk  Worked like a charm (the stick was only about 36" but that was plenty for where I fish.
thanks guys.. one more stupid question, lol the ducer has to be just under the bottom of the ice level yes? i've only used the fish-tv lol

I started ice fishing with the same finder sir.. it was the best one i ever used.  And yes it has to at least be laying flat on the surface of the water. In real clear, smooth, black ice, my transducer used to read through the ice.. no holes! My new ones won't do that.
It doesn't have to be below the bottom of the ice, but most will set it up that way.

X2 on making your own bracket.   The disposable latern batteries get expensive in the long-run...you can buy 6V rechargeable batteries from most hobby stores, involves some simple wiring work though.   Feel free to PM me if you'd like to know how to convert to the rechargeables as I have step-wise pics (generously sent to me by another member on this site).    Look for this type of battery or similar...  http://www.amazon.com/4-5H-Lead-Acid-Rechargeable-Battery/dp/B000FCRUH4
Also works great screwed to the bottom of a javex jug , fits perfectly down the hole .

that unit is still great... mine does read thru the ice if its solid and has no air pockets or crap in it. but most times it gets a bad reading... it has a speed control for the ducer so i can play with it, and it does pick up my larger jigs and spoons  seems simple enough to rig up, i took the suction cup off and have a hockey stick ready.. thanks for the tips
